trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection> class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects, which in turn represent the data points that are part of a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object.
This collection class is implemented as the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.Points%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object.
<xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects can be appended or inserted into the collection with their X-value and Y-value(s) already specified as parameters.

Note that they are also added automatically when a series is bound to a data source using either the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.DataBindY%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.DataBindXY%2A> method.

Data points are plotted in the order that they occur in this collection only if the series that the collection belongs to has its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.IsXValueIndexed%2A> property set to `true` (the default value is `false`), or if all X-values for all data points are zero.
Otherwise data points are plotted using their X-values.
Data points can be located, and manipulated, based on maximum, minimum or specified X or Y-values using the overloaded `FindMaxValue`, `FindMinValue` or `FindValue` methods, respectively.

The [DataPointCollection.Count](<xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Count%2A>) property indicates the total number of items in the collection and is commonly used to find the upper bound of the collection.
Adds a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object to the collection and sets its Y value.
The Y-value.
The new <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object to the end of the collection, with the specified X-value and Y-value.

This method adds <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection>; the object is always added to the end of the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.AddXY%2A> method overload if your data points require more than one Y-value.
If your data points do not need an X-value—that is, if you are creating non-scatter plots—use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.AddY%2A> method instead.
X-value of the data point.
Y-value of the data point.
An `integer` that represents the zero-based index where the item was inserted into the data point collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object to the end of the collection, with the specified X-value and Y-value(s).

This method adds one <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection>; the data point is always added to the end of the collection.
You must provide at least one (1) Y-value, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

This method also checks the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.YValueType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection> object that this data belongs to; if too many Y-values are specified, an exception will be thrown.
In order for <xref:System.DateTime> formatting to have an effect, a value must be a <xref:System.DateTime> object.
If your data points do not need an X-value—that is, if you are creating non-scatter plots—use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.AddY%2A> method instead
The X value of the data point.
One or more comma-separated values that represent the Y-value(s) of the data point.
An `integer` value that represents the zero-based index where the item was inserted into the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object to the end of the collection, with the specified Y-value.

This method adds one <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection>; the data point is always added to the end of the collection.
Use the method definition that allows for an array of Y-values if your data points require more than one Y-value.
If your data points need an X-value—that is, if you are creating scatter plots—use one of the `AddXY` methods instead.
The Y-value of the data point.
An `integer` that represents the zero-based index where the item was inserted into the data point collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object to the end of the collection, with the specified Y-value(s).

This method adds one <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection>; the data point is always added to the end of the collection.
You must provide at least one (1) Y-value, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

This method also checks the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.ChartType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> object this data belongs to; if too many Y-values are specified, an exception will be thrown.
The X-value will always be set to zero (0), resulting in non-scatter plots.
If you want the data points to use an X-value, call one of the `AddXY` methods instead.
In order for <xref:System.DateTime> formatting to have an effect, a value must be a <xref:System.DateTime> object.
Refer to the following for a complete listing of valid .NET Framework types that can be used for the object type parameters:
String
DateTime
Double
Decimal
Single
Int32
UInt32
Int64
UInt64
A comma-separated list of Y-value(s) of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object added to the collection.
An `integer` that represents the location in zero-based index where the item was inserted into the collection.
Data binds the X-value, Y-value(s) and property values of the data points, such as Tooltip or LabelStyle, to the data source.
The data source can be the Ole(SQL)DataReader, DataView, DataSet, DataTable or DataRow.
The data source.
The name of the field for X-values.
A comma separated names of the fields for Y-values.
Other data point properties with binding rules, in the format: PointProperty=Field[{Format}] [,PointProperty=Field[{Format}]].
For example: "Tooltip=Price{C1},Url=WebSiteName".
Data binds the X-value and Y-values of the collection's data points to the first columns of the specified data source.

This method binds all <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>, and uses separate data sources for the X and Y-value(s).
Note that the first available column in the data source will be used if data-binding to a table.
To bind to a column other than the first column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.DataBindXY%2A> method.
You can bind to multiple Y-values by providing a comma-separated list of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> objects for the `yValues` parameter.
If Y-values are not provided by the data source, or if the wrong number of values are provided, an exception will be thrown.
If you do not want to display scatter-type plots, in which both X and Y-values are used, use one of the `DataBindY` methods instead.
The following is a list of objects that you can use as the data source parameter:
DataView
Data readers (SQL, OleDB)
Arrays
Lists
All other objects that use the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
The data source that will supply the X-values for the data points.
A comma-separated list of the Y-value(s) of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object added to the collection.
Data binds the X-value and Y-values of the data points in the collection to the specified columns of the specified data sources.
Data binds the X-value and Y-values of the data points in the collection to the specified data source's first columns.
You can bind to several Y-values by setting the `yFields` parameter to multiple column names.
Separate the column names with commas.
If Y-values are not provided by the data source, or if the wrong number of values are provided, an exception will be thrown.
If you do not want to display scatter-type plots, in which both X and Y-values are used, use one of the `DataBindY` methods instead.
The following is a list of objects that you can use as the data source parameter:
DataView
Data readers (SQL, OleDB)
Arrays
Lists
All other objects that use the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
The data source that will supply the X-values for the data points.
The name of the column that will supply the X-values for the data points.
A comma-separated list of the Y-value(s) of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object added to the collection.
A comma-separated list of column name(s) that will supply the Y-values for the data points.
Note that a comma can be embedded as part of a column name, by using a double comma.
Data binds the Y-value(s) of the collection's data points to the first column of the specified data source(s).
This method binds the Y-value(s) of the data points in the collection to the first column of the specified data source(s).
To bind Y-values to a data source column that is not the first available column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.DataBindY%2A> method.
You can bind several Y-values by specifying multiple data sources, using the `yValue` parameter.
Note that the first available column in each data source will be used for each data point's successive Y-values.

For example, the first column of the first <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> data source will be bound to the first Y-value of data points, the first column of the second <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> data source will be bound to the second Y-value of data points, and so forth.
If Y-values are not provided by the data source, or if the wrong number of values are provided, an exception will be thrown.
The following is a list of objects that you can use as the data source parameter:
The following is a list of objects that you can use as the data source:
DataView
Data readers (SQL, OleDB)
Arrays
Lists
All other objects that use the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
One or more comma-separated <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> data sources.
Data binds the Y-value(s) of the data points to the specified column(s) of the specified data source.
This method binds the Y-values of the data points in the collection to the specified fields(s) of the data source.
To bind only to the first field in a data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection.DataBindY%2A> method.
You can bind to several fields by setting the `yFields` parameter to multiple field names that are comma-separated.
Note that the first field will be used for the data point's first Y-value, the second named field will be used for the data point's second Y-value, and so forth.
If Y-values are not provided by the data source, or the wrong number of values are provided, an exception will be thrown.
The following is a list of objects that you can use as the data source:
DataView
Data readers (SQL, OleDB)
Arrays
Lists
All other objects that use the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> data source object that provides the Y-value(s).
The data source field(s) to which to bind data point(s).
Note that a comma can be embedded as part of a column name, by using a double comma.
Finds all the data points that are equal to the specified value, starting from the specified index location.
The data point value to find.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
The index location of the data point to start searching from.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> interface that represents the enumerator of the matching data points.
Finds all the data points that are equal to the specified value.
The data point value to find.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> interface that represents the enumerator of the matching data points.
Find all the data points that are equal to the specified value.
The data point value to find.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> interface that represents the enumerator of the matching data points.
Finds the first data point that is equal to the specified value.
The data point value to find.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> that matches the specified value, or `null` if there is no match.
Finds the first data point that is equal to the specified value.
The data point value to find.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> that matches the specified value, or `null` if there is no match.
Finds the first data point that is equal to the specified value, starting from the specified index location.
The data point value to find.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
The index location of the data point to start searching from.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> that matches the specified value, or `null` if there is no match.
Finds the data point with the maximum value.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object with the maximum value.
Finds the data point value with the maximum value.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object with the maximum value.
Finds the data point with the maximum value, starting from the specified index location.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
The index location of the data point to start searching from.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object with the maximum value.
Finds the data point with the minimum value.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object with the minimum value.
Finds the data point with the minimum value.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object with the minimum value.
Finds the data point with the minimum value, starting from the specified index location.
The data point value to use (X, Y1, Y2...).
The index location of the data point to start searching from.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> object with the minimum value.
Inserts a data point with the specified X value and one or more specified Y values.
The index after which the data point will be inserted.
The X value of the data point.
A comma-separated list of Y values of the data point.
Inserts a data point with one or more specified Y values.
The index after which the data point will be inserted.
A comma-separated list of Y values of the data point.
